title: Augusta County: Martha L. Roadcap to John B. McGuffin, June 3, 1861
summary: Martha Roadcap writes to her son, John, about the excitement and anxiety at home, and about the results of the local elections. She asks John and his brother Charles to send her an account of their personal belongings and unsettled business, should she lose either of them in the war, and also asks that they both write her more often.
